channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: New York City Mayor Eric Adams indicted in federal corruption probe: Report
item.description: New York City Mayor Eric L Adams has been indicted in a federal corruption investigation. The sealed charges are likely to affect the city's political dynamics ahead of an upcoming mayoral primary. Adams insists on his innocence and pledges to fight the allegations, as calls for his resignation intensify.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Hindus go back': BAPS temple vandalised in US; 2nd incident in month
item.description: The BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir in Sacramento, California was vandalized with anti-Hindu messages, echoing a recent incident in New York. The Hindu American Foundation and local officials condemned the act, noting an increase in anti-Hindu hate crimes. Authorities are urged to promote safety and respect for all faiths within the community.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Secret Service agent under lens over 'sexual misconduct' involving Kamala Harris staffer
item.description: The US Secret Service is investigating an agent following an incident with Kamala Harris' staff. The agent is on administrative leave amid allegations of misconduct in a Wisconsin hotel room during a trip to scout campaign stops. The alleged incident led to the cancellation of the planned Harris event.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Passenger killed when gunman hijacks city bus, leads police on chase through downtown Los Angeles
item.description: In Los Angeles, a gunman hijacked a city bus, leading to a slow police chase that ended with the suspect's arrest. One passenger was killed, while the driver and another passenger were treated at the scene. Authorities are looking into ways to enhance safety on public transportation systems.

item.title: Putin issues nuclear warnings to the West over strikes from Ukraine
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin updated the country's nuclear doctrine, warning that any conventional attack on Russia by a non-nuclear state, if backed by a nuclear power, will be seen as a joint attack. Ukrainian officials called this nuclear blackmail. The Biden administration has not authorized Kyiv to strike inside Russia.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Helene prompts mass evacuations in Florida as it nears landfall
item.description: Hurricane Helene intensifies as it nears Florida, causing destruction in Mexico and leading to evacuations across the Southeast. President Joe Biden declares a state of emergency in Florida. The storm is projected to maintain its strength with winds over 110 mph, expected to make landfall in Florida's Big Bend region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'He took a bullet for democracy': Trump to hold rally at site of assassination attempt
item.description: Donald Trump is set to hold a rally on October 5 in Butler, Pennsylvania, revisiting the site of a July assassination attempt. The event will honor Corey Comperatore, who died shielding his family during the attack. Trump will also recognize other victims and express gratitude to law enforcement and first responders.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau survives no-confidence vote amid conservative pressure
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau narrowly survived a no-confidence vote with 211 lawmakers opposing and 120 in favour. Conservative leader Pierre Poilievre introduced the motion, criticising Trudeau's handling of high living costs and rising crime rates. The Liberals face increased vulnerability after the NDP withdrew from their coalition agreement, leading to heightened political tension.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why are christians calling for a boycott of Coca-Cola over 'Jesus' custom cans?
item.description: A video showing a Coca-Cola machine declining to print 'Jesus' on a custom soda can has incited outrage among some Christian consumers, prompting boycott calls. Antwoine Hill's Facebook post revealed that other religious names were accepted. Coca-Cola explained that phrases might be rejected due to trademark or potential offensiveness.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris leads Donald Trump by narrow margin in key battleground state: Survey
item.description: Kamala Harris edges out Donald Trump in a recent Monmouth University poll conducted in Pennsylvania. Harris secures 40 percent definite support while Trump has 38 percent. Voters identify inflation as their primary concern, followed by economic growth, abortion, and immigration. The survey sampled 654 voters with a margin of error of plus or minus 4.5 percentage points.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Two Injured in 'intentionally set' explosive device blast at California courthouse
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US woman ends life using 'suicide pod': What is it, how does it work?
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'She will protect...': Jennifer Lawrence backs Kamala Harris for US presidential polls
item.description: Jennifer Lawrence has officially endorsed Kamala Harris and Tim Walz for the 2024 US presidential election, citing Harris's dedication to protecting women's rights post-Roe v Wade. The actress is also producing documentaries on women’s issues and abortion rights. Celebrities like Taylor Swift and Billie Eilish have similarly endorsed the Democratic candidates.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris falls short of Biden’s 2020 polling numbers: CNN poll
item.description: Political strategist Scott Jennings has expressed concerns over Kamala Harris's polling numbers. A CNN poll shows her leading Trump among voters under 35 but struggling with key demographics like young voters and working-class individuals. This raises questions about the Democratic Party’s prospects in the upcoming elections, emphasising the importance of engaging young voters.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: California governor signs bills to bolster gun control
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has signed several new gun control laws aimed at expanding restrictions on firearm ownership. These include provisions against individuals involved in stalking, animal cruelty, and domestic violence. The legislation also targets ghost guns and aims to enhance protections for domestic violence survivors. Newsom stressed California's proactive approach amid a lack of federal action.

item.title: 'We really need to do it': JPMorgan CEO backs Elon Musk’s ‘very good idea’
item.description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon endorses Elon Musk's proposal for a government efficiency commission, emphasizing the need for accountability and efficient public spending at the India Investor Summit. Former President Donald Trump also supports the idea, pledging to appoint Musk if re-elected. The commission aims to audit federal operations and recommend reforms to eliminate fraud.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'You will not boost your power at Ukraine's expense': Zelenskyy takes aim at China, Brazil
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressed the UN General Assembly, questioning China and Brazil's true interest in proposing peace talks with Russia. He criticized temporary truce plans and asserted that Ukraine would reject any externally imposed agreements. Zelenskyy cautioned that alternative peace efforts would only prolong the conflict instead of achieving genuine resolution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US revokes Georgian PM's Invitation to Biden's UN reception amid strained ties
item.description: Georgian Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze's invitation to a reception hosted by US President Joe Biden during the UNGA was revoked due to alleged anti-democratic actions and negative rhetoric towards the US. This development underscores strained relations between Georgia and Western powers, amid accusations of authoritarianism and pro-Russian policies from the ruling Georgian Dream party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man hijacks bus in Los Angeles, 1 passenger killed
item.description: Early Wednesday in downtown Los Angeles, a man hijacked a Metro bus, holding the driver at gunpoint and fatally shooting a passenger. Police pursued the bus for an hour before arresting the suspect and finally later the driver and another passenger were rescued without injuries. Police said that the investigation remains ongoing.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israeli NGO Shavei Israel appeals for immigration of deceased Indian-origin soldier Geri Gideon Hanghal's family
item.description: Shavei Israel, an Israeli NGO, is calling for support to help the family of Indian-origin Staff Sergeant Geri Gideon Hanghal immigrate to Israel after he was killed in a vehicle-ramming attack. The organization emphasizes aiding Bnei Menashe community members still in India who wish to make aliyah.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
